revision:
1. A bar graph is used to show comparison among categories. It may consist of two or more parallel vertical bars.
  2. A pie-graph is used to compare parts of a whole.
  3. A Histogram is a bar graph that shows data in intervals. It has adjacent bars over the intervals.
  4. A line graph displays data that changes continuously over periods of time.
    • Each piece of data is shown by a point on the square grid.
    • The points are then connected by line segments. The result is the line graph
  5. The horizontal axis is usually the x-axis
  6. The vertical axis is usually the y-axis
